notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Many folios damaged in the margins (modern restoration, stuck on paper). Slightly worm-eaten. Stained.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: An Arabic commentary on the book of Ecclesiastes.

collation.p: 7 complete quires, folios 42-111, marked by Arabic letters on the upper left-hand corner of the first page, and parts of a number of incomplete quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Arabic Naskhi script of approximately 13th to 14th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Ecclesiastes with Commentary. Hebrew & Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2555.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [130v].
